_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Saputo is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  If such a release does occur, our employees are trained to follow the Emergency Response Plan and to evacuate the facility as necessary. We are also coordinated with the Barron County LEPC which provides additional emergency response expertise.



2.  FACILITY INFORMATION & REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The Saputo Cheese USA Inc. - Almena facility is located at 1052 6th Street, Almena, WI 54805. The plant's primary products are cheese and whey. The facility employs approximately 150 full-time employees. There is one RMP-regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, used in the plant's refrigeration systems to provide refrigeration for processing and cold storage of products. SCUSA - Almena has two ammonia systems. Together, they are over 10,000 lbs. and covered as a single covered process in Program Level 3. They're designated as the "Old" and "New" systems. The Old system contains 9,446 lbs. and the New system contains 8,943 lbs. for a total combined inventory of 18,389 lbs.



3.  GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE & CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION

The Saputo Cheese USA Inc. - Almena plant follows the 14 elements of the OSHA Process Safety Management program as a release prevention program for RMP. In addition, Saputo Corporate - Department of Environmental Affairs works with the plant confirming regulatory and corporate standards are being followed, providing guidance and standardization on the RMP and OSHA PSM programs and acting as a resource for the plant on the RMP, PSM and other environmental pro

grams.



4.  FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Saputo Cheese USA Inc. - Almena has had a good record of preventing accidental releases over the last five years.  Due to our release prevention policies, no incidents, as defined by the RMP rule, have occurred in the past five years.



5.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Saputo Cheese USA Inc. - Almena developed an Emergency Response Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials as well as other emergency events that might occur at the plant. The purpose of Saputo's Emergency Response Plan is to ensure employees know and understand what to do in the event of an emergency in order to minimize injuries and property damage. The plan includes various aspects of an emergency including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies. Specific employees are trained and certified as medical responders. All employees are trained in evacuation, hazard communication, and chemical safety. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect pertinent changes.



6.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program. Recommendations resulting from the PHA, compliance audits and mechanical integrity inspections will be addressed in a timely manner. In addition, regular interaction with Saputo Corporate - Department of Environmental Affairs, Health & Safety and Risk Group will improve compliance and overall plant safety.
